0.title: Contraindications
0.mono:
• hypersensitivity to gentian violet
  • patients with porphyria
  • use on ulcerative lesions or open wounds

3.title: Breast Feeding
3.mono:
• WHO: Compatible with breastfeeding.
  • Micromedex: Infant risk is minimal.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Vaginal: Possesses antifungal and anthelmintic activity, as well as bactericidal and bacteriostatic activities against gram-positive bacteria .

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• clinical improvement in the signs and symptoms of infection being treated
  • cultures if deemed necessary
  • mucosal irritation

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Warn patients that permanent pigmentation may occur if drug contacts granulation tissue.
  • This drug may cause skin or mucous membrane irritation, skin ulceration, or staining of skin.
